_exec_summary.SummaryText:
he threat and impact to nearby members of the community.

The Facility is strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety and health. Safety at the Facility depends on the
manner in which flammable substances are handled as well as the various safety devices incorporated into the design of the
processes. Furthermore, comprehensive training is provided to employees and contractors which reinforces the safety policies and
procedures of the Facility. Programs have been established to help prevent any accidental releases and to train personnel for
emergency response in the event of a release.

Sunoco has implemented safety precautions and procedures designed to prevent and mitigate catastrophic releases. Sunoco has active operating, maintenance, training and inspection procedures. Sunoco provides annual emergency response training to its employees. 

Sunoco's management is committed to the following:

- Preventing accidents;

- Training our employees in correct response procedures in the event of an accident;

- Participating in community emergency preparedness;

- Addressing any citizen concerns by fully explaining potential hazards associated with Sunoco operations and all steps being taken
to prevent and mitigate accidents; and

- Being a good corporate citizen in Berks County.

With these objectives in mind, the Risk Management Plan has been developed to provide information regarding the management of the risks associated with the flammable substance storage process. Above all, Sunoco stresses its commitment to ensuring a safe working environment for employees, visitors and the community.

Sunoco Pipeline
Montello Pump Station
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The Sunoco Pipeline, Montello Pump Station, hereafter referred to as the Facility, is a refined petroleum product storage and distribution facility in Township of Spring, PA.

The Facility handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, diesel, ethanol, and petroleum-based additives.  The Facility has a fixed inventory of pentane. Pentane is received by truck and stored in one 90,000-gallon pressurized storage vessel and subsequently injected into one gasoline pipeline.

The facility has 3 operators at a time that could be at the facility to operate the pentane system.  The remainder of the FTEs reported at the site are located at the facility buildings, but are not operating the pentane system. 

Two requirements of this section specifically apply to operations at the Facility:

1. Purpose and General Duty Clause - The essence of the general duty clause is that an owner/operator that stores and uses hazardous chemicals in any quantity has a fundamental obligation to ensure a safe operation and to have plans in place in the event of an accident to appropriately manage the situation.

Sunoco is committed to ensuring the safe operation of the Facility, as well as all of its other operations, to ensure a safe workplace for employees and a safe location for neighbors in the community. Sunoco has procedures in place to prevent accidents and is committed to emergency preparedness both for the Facility and community-wide and coordinates with the Berks County LEPC/West Side Regional Emergency Management Agency and the Township of Spring Fire Rescue Services.

2. Risk Management Plan - The primary function of the Facility is to act as a flammable liquid storage and distribution facility. Due to
the flammable effects associated with pentane, it is necessary to observe certain safety precautions to prevent unnecessary human
